question.title: Jooq get sequence increment
question.body:
Maybe there's an easier way to get the Increment with JOOQ? This one looks more like a crutch:

int increment =
    Optional.ofNullable(CUSTOMER_ID_SEQ.getIncrementBy())
        .map(Field::getName)
        .map(Integer::valueOf)
        .orElse(1);

answers.body:
Current API design

The reason why these sequence attribute meta data methods return a Field<T> rather than just T is to be able to provide DataType<T> information, which may occasionally be useful.

There could be an argument held in favour of returning Param<T>, whose Param::getValue method would provide easier access to the actual value. But historically, any such reference to a Param type in the API had to eventually be reconsidered because even in the most param-y use-cases, there will be a RDBMS that would still accept non-param arguments (e.g. expressions). One example is the SELECT .. LIMIT clause, where 99% of all arguments will be a Param (i.e. a constant), but many RDBMS do support expressions, including subqueries.

It's still very unlikely that sequence flags like INCREMENT BY would accept expressions, but you never know, so Field<T> will remain.

Alternative access patterns

Knowing that:

  1. Currently (jOOQ 3.20), the getIncrementBy() return value is always a Param
  2. It is unlikely for this to change in the near future

You can just downcast like this:

int incrementBy = ((Param<Integer>) CUSTOMER_ID_SEQ.getIncrementBy()).getValue();

Or, alternatively, with a type check, if you want a "safer" route (though, your code would still break if there was a non-param flag):

int incrementBy = CUSTOMER_ID_SEQ.getIncrementBy() instanceof Param<Integer> p 
    ? p.getValue() 
    : 0;
